definition[0]: to not take someone or something with you when you leave a place
example[0]: I think I might have left my wallet behind.
example[1]: He departed for Washington, leaving the children behind with their mother.
definition[1]: if a person, country, or organization is left behind, they do not develop as quickly or make as much progress as other people, countries etc
example[2]: In class, a child with poor eyesight can soon get left behind.
example[3]: a fear of being left behind by better-organized rivals
definition[2]: to permanently stop being involved with a person, place, or situation
example[4]: It’s time to leave the past behind.
example[5]: Although Armstrong overcame the circumstances of his birth, he never really left New Orleans behind.
definition[3]: to move away from someone or something
example[6]: They had left the city behind and were heading into open country.
example[7]: Sarah, with her long legs, soon left the rest of us far behind.
definition[4]: to produce a thing or situation that remains after you have gone
example[8]: He drove off, leaving behind him a trail of blue smoke.
example[9]: the mess the previous government left behind
